WorkItem.Description:
I get the following error when I try to load up Rawr on my workplace machine:
 
"Rawr.exe - Application Error
The application failed to initialize properly (0xc0000135). Click on OK to terminate the application."
 
I am running Windows XP Pro SP2 on a machine with an Intel Celeron 1.8 Ghz CPU and 512MB of memory. I do not experience this at home on my XP machine running a Core2Duo w/close to 3 GB of RAM. When I check my Event Viewer and get details on the error, it provides me with the following:
 
"Product: Windows Operating System 
ID: 26 
Source: Application Popup 
Version: 5.0 
Symbolic Name: status_log_hard_error 
Message: Unable to Load Device Driver : device driver could not be loaded. 
    
Explanation 
The program could not load a driver because the program user doesn't have sufficient privileges to access the driver or because the drive is missing or corrupt.
 
    
User Action 
To correct this problem:
 
Reinstall the program to restore the driver to the correct location."
 
What drivers could Rawr possibly need? I have integrated video and audio solutions, but nothing fancy as this a self-made barebones workstation at my office. I have tried compatibility modes, but I am otherwise at a loss.

Comments.Message:
Nevermind, I'm a bit of a goof. I forgot that this machine was loaded completely clean, and as such did not have .NET Framework updated. Sorry!

That said, could a graceful error be added to the beginning in a future release that notifies someone they need to update/install the proper version? Might save some redundancy.

I'm going to go RTFM now.

Nope, actually. None of Rawr's code gets run because it needs the .NET Framework to even start running Rawr. So there's no way I can pop a nice error message; Windows just basically says, "wtf? I don't know how to run this kind of program. BLECH!"
